file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 36-20-01-04 - TEMPERATURE SENSOR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TEMPERATURE SENSOR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the temperature sensors of the precoolers of the bleed system. B. These procedures are applicable to the inlet and outlet temperature sensors. C. The inlet temperature sensors are installed in the LH and RH pylons. D. The outlet temperature sensors are installed below the baggage compartment floor. E. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 36-20-01-000-801-A TEMPERATURE SENSOR - REMOVAL TEMPERATURE SENSOR - INSTALLA- ALL 36-20-01-400-801-A TION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 36-20-01 Page 1 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 36-20-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. TEMPERATURE SENSOR - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the temperature sensor. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM MPP 06-43-00/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION AMM TASK 25-51-01-000-801-A/400 BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT LINING - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 414 414CB LH Pylon 414 414DB LH Pylon 424 424CB RH Pylon 424 424DB RH Pylon 271 271BF Below the baggage compartment floor 272 272BF Below the baggage compartment floor D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task LH or RH Pylon or baggage compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Remove access panels 414CB and 414DB or 424CB, and 424DB ( AMM MPP 06-43-00/100), as applicable. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 36-20-01 Page 2 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Remove baggage compartment floor panels 271BF and 272BF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 and AMM TASK 25-51-01-000-801-A/400), as applicable. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A WARNING: DO NOT TOUCH THE BLEED-AIR SYSTEM DUCTS OR COMPONENTS IMMEDIATELY AFTER THE ENGINE STOPS, BECAUSE OF THE HIGH BLEED- AIR TEMPERATURE CAN CAUSE INJURY TO PERSONS. (1) Disconnect the electrical connector (4). (2) Remove the temperature sensor (3) from the duct (1). (3) Remove and discard the old O-ring (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 36-20-01 Page 3 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 36-20-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. TEMPERATURE SENSOR - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the temperature sensor. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM MPP 06-43-00/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION AMM TASK 25-51-01-400-801-A/400 BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT LINING - INSTALLATION IPC 36-20-01 TEMPERATURE SENSOR C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 414 414CB LH Pylon 414 414DB LH Pylon 424 424CB RH Pylon 424 424DB RH Pylon 271 271BF Below the baggage compartment floor 272 272BF Below the baggage compartment floor D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) O-ring IPC 36-20-01 AR H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task LH or RH Pylon or baggage compartment EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 36-20-01 Page 6 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Install the new O-ring (2). (2) Install the temperature sensor (3) to the duct (1). (3) Connect the electrical connector (4). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install access panels 414CB and 414DB or 424CB, and 424DB ( AMM MPP 06-43-00/100). as applicable. (2) Install baggage compartment floor panels 271BF and 272BF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 and AMM TASK 25-51-01-400-801-A/400), as applicable.
